poem:
Title: "Manifesto of the Morning News"

Across the breakfast table,
the newspaper shouts a discord,
a squabble of Stereo Sound 
unmuddied by the bitter tea.

In the town of Grimsby, 7pm awaits,
a looming theatre under the overseer's gaze,
Sunak and Starmer, gladiators of promise,
scraps of ambition scattering like breadcrumbs.

Normative grey suits under Sky's pale light.
Our anticipatory quiet,
pregnant with £71bn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labour says Tory manifesto includes ‘£71bn of unfunded spending commitments’ – UK politics live 4.50pm BST It felt like the executives at Sky News were enjoying having a pop at ITV when the channel announced the format for its leaders special programme, with a live studio audience, in Grimsby on tomorrow at 7pm. Rishi Sunak and Sir Keir Starmer will face questions from @BethRigby and members of the public during Sky News' special leaders' event.👉". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Labour says Tory manifesto includes ‘£71bn of unfunded spending commitments’ – UK politics live 4.50pm BST It felt like the executives at Sky News were enjoying having a pop at ITV when the channel announced the format for its leaders special programme, with a live studio audience, in Grimsby on tomorrow at 7pm. Rishi Sunak and Sir Keir Starmer will face questions from @BethRigby and members of the public during Sky News' special leaders' event.👉
